definitions: fertile land along river valleys prone to periodic flooding
examples: The farmers cultivated corn in the rich bottomland soil
Mississippi River bottomland provides habitat for diverse wildlife species

definitions: severe paralytic illness caused by nerve toxins produced by Clostridium botulinum bacteria
examples: The health department investigated several botulism cases linked to canned goods
Improper food preservation can lead to dangerous botulism outbreaks

definitions: woman's private bedroom or dressing room for intimate relaxation
examples: She retreated to her boudoir to read private correspondence
The Victorian mansion featured an elegant boudoir with silk wallpaper

definitions: main branch of a tree extending from the trunk
examples: Heavy snow broke several boughs from the old oak tree
Birds nested in the sheltered boughs of the pine forest

definitions: thin clear soup made by simmering meat or vegetables in water
examples: She sipped chicken bouillon to settle her upset stomach
The recipe calls for vegetable bouillon as the base ingredient

definitions: large rounded rock worn smooth by water or weathering
examples: Climbers practiced their technique on the massive granite boulder
The glacier left enormous boulders scattered across the valley floor

definitions: broad street often lined with trees and designed for leisurely travel
examples: Sunset Boulevard stretches through the heart of Los Angeles
They strolled along the tree-lined boulevard on Sunday afternoon

definitions: act of rebounding after hitting a surface
elastic quality that causes rebounding
energetic liveliness in movement or manner
examples: The ball lost its bounce after years of use
She watched the bounce of the basketball on the court
The new mattress has excellent bounce and support
Tennis balls must maintain consistent bounce for professional play
There was extra bounce in her step after the promotion
The music had a lively bounce that energized the crowd

definitions: security personnel who controls entry to nightclubs or bars
fast short-pitched delivery in cricket that rises sharply
examples: The bouncer checked identification at the nightclub entrance
Two bouncers escorted the disruptive patron from the venue
The fast bowler delivered a dangerous bouncer at head height
Several bouncers unsettled the batting team during the match

definitions: continuous act of rebounding or moving up and down elastically
examples: The bouncing of the trampoline delighted the children
Constant bouncing damaged the car's suspension system

definitions: limiting line or edge that marks extent
energetic leap or spring forward
headed toward a specific destination
examples: The property bound extends to the river bank
Mathematical proofs must work within logical bounds
The deer cleared the fence in a single bound
With a bound she reached the finish line
The ship was bound for tropical Caribbean ports
These documents are bound for the head office

definitions: line that marks the limits of an area or territory
limit or edge beyond which something cannot or should not go
examples: The river forms a natural boundary between the two countries
Surveyors marked the property boundary with steel posts
Scientists push the boundaries of human knowledge every day
Professional boundaries maintain appropriate workplace relationships

definitions: generous gift or liberal giving of something valuable
payment offered as reward for capture or achievement
abundant crop yield or natural provision
examples: The charity distributed its bounty among needy families
Nature's bounty provided food for the entire village
The government posted a bounty for information about fugitives
Bounty hunters tracked criminals across the western frontier
Farmers celebrated the autumn bounty after excellent weather
The ocean's bounty sustained coastal communities for generations

definitions: artistic arrangement of cut flowers for decoration or gift
characteristic fragrance of wine appreciated by connoisseurs
examples: She carried a stunning bouquet of roses down the aisle
The florist created bouquets for the wedding reception
This vintage displays an exceptional bouquet with hints of oak
Wine experts evaluated the bouquet before tasting

definitions: American whiskey distilled primarily from corn mash and aged in charred oak barrels
examples: Kentucky bourbon must meet strict production standards
He ordered bourbon on the rocks at the bar

definitions: member of the middle class with conventional attitudes and materialistic values
examples: The bourgeois lifestyle emphasized material comfort and social respectability
Marxist theory critiqued bourgeois control of production means

definitions: social class of people between aristocracy and working class typically owning property and businesses
examples: The bourgeoisie emerged as a powerful force during industrialization
Revolutionary movements often targeted the bourgeoisie and aristocracy equally

definitions: short period of intense activity or experience of something
organized boxing or wrestling match between opponents
examples: She suffered a severe bout of flu last winter
After a bout of heavy rain the sun finally appeared
The championship bout attracted thousands of spectators
Both fighters trained intensively for the title bout

definitions: small shop selling fashionable clothes or accessories
small specialized business offering unique products or services
examples: The boutique featured designer dresses from Paris
She opened a boutique selling handmade jewelry
They hired a boutique consulting firm for the project
Boutique hotels offer personalized luxury experiences

definitions: animal of the cattle family including cows, bulls, and oxen
examples: Veterinarians examined the bovine herd for disease
Bovine products include milk, meat, and leather

definitions: curved weapon for shooting arrows using elastic tension
curved or bent shape resembling an arc
forward part of a ship or boat
bending forward gesture showing respect or acknowledgment
examples: The archer drew the bow to its full extension
Traditional bow hunting requires exceptional skill and patience
The rainbow formed a perfect bow across the sky
She tied the ribbon into a decorative bow
Waves crashed over the ship's bow during the storm
The crew gathered at the bow to spot whales
The performer took a bow after the standing ovation
Diplomats exchanged formal bows at the ceremony

definitions: intestine or part of the alimentary canal below the stomach
examples: Doctors examined her bowel for signs of inflammation
Regular fiber intake promotes healthy bowel function

definitions: pleasant shady place under trees or climbing plants in a garden
examples: They exchanged vows in the rose bower behind the mansion
Birds nested in the quiet bower of intertwined vines

definitions: large arctic whale with massive bow-shaped skull and long baleen plates
examples: Bowhead whales can break through arctic ice with their heads
Indigenous peoples traditionally hunted bowhead whales for sustenance

definitions: action of bending forward as gesture or playing stringed instruments with a bow
examples: The violinist's bowing technique produced beautiful sustained notes
Formal bowing etiquette varies significantly between Asian cultures

definitions: round deep dish used for food or liquids
bowl-shaped stadium or geographical formation
game of bowling or act of rolling the ball
examples: She served soup in ceramic bowls for dinner
The mixing bowl contained ingredients for chocolate cake
Thousands attended the college football bowl game
The geological bowl trapped rainwater forming a lake
They bowl every Friday night at the local alley
His perfect bowl knocked down all the pins

definitions: cricket player who delivers the ball to the batsman
person who plays the sport of bowling
rounded felt hat popular in Victorian era
examples: The fast bowler took five wickets in the match
Spin bowlers rely on technique rather than speed
She became the league's top bowler with consistent strikes
Professional bowlers compete in televised tournaments
He wore a traditional bowler hat to the formal event
Charlie Chaplin made the bowler hat iconic in films

definitions: sport of rolling a ball down a lane to knock down pins
examples: Bowling requires precision and consistent technique
The bowling alley hosted league championships every summer

definitions: person skilled in archery especially a warrior or hunter using a bow
examples: Medieval bowmen could pierce armor at considerable distances
The bowman drew his arrow and aimed carefully

definitions: spar extending forward from a sailing vessel's bow to which forestays are fastened
examples: Sailors secured the jib to the bowsprit before departure
The bowsprit broke during the violent storm at sea

definitions: string of a bow that propels arrows when released from tension
examples: The archer replaced the worn bowstring before competition
Traditional bowstrings were made from animal sinew

definitions: rigid container typically rectangular with a lid for storage
small separated seating area in a theater or stadium
sport of boxing or act of fighting with fists
examples: She packed her belongings in cardboard boxes for moving
The jewelry box contained her grandmother's pearls
They watched the opera from their private box
Corporate sponsors occupied luxury boxes at the stadium
Professional boxers train for months before championship fights
He learned to box at the neighborhood gym

definitions: enclosed railroad car designed for transporting freight and cargo
examples: Boxcars carried manufactured goods across the country
Workers loaded grain into the weatherproof boxcar

definitions: athlete who participates in the sport of boxing
medium-sized dog breed with a square muzzle and muscular build
examples: The boxer trained six hours daily for the title fight
Professional boxers must pass medical examinations regularly
Their boxer dog was gentle despite its intimidating appearance
Boxers make excellent family pets with proper training

definitions: sport of fighting with fists while wearing padded gloves in a roped square ring
examples: Boxing requires exceptional physical conditioning and mental discipline
Olympic boxing follows strict amateur competition rules

definitions: slow-growing evergreen shrub with small leaves used for hedges and wood carving
examples: Gardeners trimmed the boxwood hedge into geometric shapes
Fine-grained boxwood makes excellent material for detailed carving

definitions: male child or youth typically before reaching adulthood
informal term for a young man or male of any age
examples: The boy played soccer in the neighborhood park
Boys and girls attended the same elementary school
The old boys gathered for their annual reunion
Local boys volunteered to help with the harvest

definitions: organized refusal to buy or participate in something as a form of protest
examples: Consumers organized a boycott of products from unethical companies
The boycott successfully pressured policy changes

definitions: male companion in a romantic or intimate relationship
examples: She introduced her boyfriend to her parents at dinner
Her boyfriend surprised her with flowers on their anniversary

definitions: period of being a boy from infancy to adolescence
examples: He spent his boyhood exploring the countryside
Boyhood memories of summer camps remained vivid

definitions: informal term for a stupid or insignificant person
examples: Some bozo parked in two spaces at once
Don't listen to that bozo giving terrible advice

definitions: measurement of tempo in music or heart rate per minute
examples: The dance track maintained a steady 120 bpm throughout
Normal resting heart rate ranges from 60 to 100 bpm

definitions: woman's undergarment worn to support the breasts
examples: She bought a new sports bra for running
The store offered professional bra fitting services

definitions: device that holds or fastens something tightly for support
pair of similar things especially game birds
examples: He wore a knee brace after the surgery
Metal braces reinforced the damaged wall structure
The hunter returned with a brace of pheasants
She bought a brace of pistols at the auction

definitions: decorative band or chain worn around the wrist as jewelry
examples: She wore a silver bracelet with small charms attached
The tennis bracelet sparkled with tiny diamonds

definitions: system of supports that strengthen or stabilize a structure
examples: Engineers added steel bracing to earthquake-proof the building
The wooden bracing prevented the scaffolding from collapsing

definitions: large coarse fern that grows densely on hillsides and in woodlands
examples: Hikers pushed through thick bracken on the mountain trail
Bracken covered the forest floor in golden brown autumn colors

definitions: right-angled support projecting from a wall
category or group within specified limits
paired punctuation marks used to enclose text
examples: She installed brackets to hold the wooden shelf
Decorative brackets supported the mantelpiece
Their income falls into a higher tax bracket
The tournament bracket showed all playoff matchups
Put your comments in brackets after the quote
Square brackets indicate editorial additions to text

definitions: thin nail with a small head or no head used in light carpentry
examples: The craftsman used brads to attach delicate molding
Finishing brads left nearly invisible holes in the wood

definitions: hillside or slope especially in Scotland or northern England
examples: Sheep grazed peacefully on the heather-covered brae
They climbed the steep brae to reach the castle
